Reviews.Content: If you are traveling anywhere near Woodland Hills, CA, the best place to stay is the Hilton Hotel. From the valet guys (Nelson, Dexter, Danny and Mark) to Eduardo at the front desk who waves to me before my feet even make it into the lobby, the customer service level is extraordinary and like no other. I travel on average 40 weeks every year and have never had a disappointing time at this hotel. It genuinely feels like home away from home every time I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “You have a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mconey
Reviews.Content: I spend about a third of my life in this hotel as I travel back and forth for my company. The service found not be any better. The front desk staff is amazing and super responsive. They have made me as close to as home as possible. Really first class. The staff in the restaurant found not be friendlier. My favorite is Yether. She always has a smile on her face and is looking to make the experience first rate. I usually will only have breakfast here and get my dinner elsewere locally within blocks, (cheesecake factory,pfcahngs, BJs,plenty of Mexican choices, mortons, etc....but the food at the Hilton is fine. I never dread coming here. I know my experience will be a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kasilwolf
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel on business about 3-4 times a month. It's always a pleasure to be greeted by Eduardo at the front desk during check in. He is so pleasant and takes very good care of me It's always good to see his smiling face. He makes you feel oh so welcome even after a long day at work. A couple of weeks ago I accidnetly locked my keys in the rental car ( never have done that before) I was stressed aboout it but Maurice from valet took me to work and said her would get my keys out of my car and drop it off at work by noon..and before noon I had my car. He made me laugh about it and made me realize this happens more than I know so I didn't feel so silly. My sincere "thanks" to Eduardo and Maurice you guys rock..I always book my travel in advance so I can be guarnteed a room at the Hilton iinstead of somewhere else. Thank you Hilton for knowing what Customer Service is all about

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service at check-in”
Reviews.Author: levangel
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel at least 2-3 times a month and love the personlaized service I get. Kudos to Eduardo for always extending a helpful hand and for making my stay superb - your welcoming smile when I check in close to midnight after a long day, helps ease my feelings of exhaustion. Keep up the excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Eduardo is amazing”
Reviews.Author: foster075
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed in this hotel for a while since i was assigned to a different office location but its always feel good to be back specially when you have a warm welcome from an amazing staff (eduardo).He has an exceptional customer services. Congratulation to the front desk manager for having such a wonderful staff..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Simply Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: cjackermann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton on several occasions in the last Quarter of 2010. I worked with Lisa Barbagallo at the hotel and she was spectacular. Took care of everything i needed and was very helpful. The whole team was very friendly and accomodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation, Great Group Sales Director”
Reviews.Author: ChurchillChuck
Reviews.Content: We bought a business in Woodland Hillsand for the last 6 months several of us have stayed extensively at the Woodland Hills Hilton. Lisa Barbagallo-Director of Group Sales has been phenominal. She has made sure that we were comfotable for our numerous visits. I am taking two mini vacations in 2011..based on the service that has been provided at the Woodland Hills Hilton...I will be staying at a Hilton on all of my trips.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk checkout was terrible”
Reviews.Author: ronicag97
Reviews.Content: My front desk experience was with an individual named Mauricio, who when asked about the parking ticket given incorrectly by the machine- was very condescending. I thought he not only had an attitude with me, but laughed when I said "well can I try the ticket and see if it works?"- the hotel was beautfiul, good service in guest store and restaurant- but Mauricio was a big downer!- also free NewsPaper delivered everymorning loved that!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TIDhome1
Reviews.Content: I really love staying at the Hilton. It is always sparkling clean and the beds are totally comfy. The support staff at the front desk (edwardo) and the vallet guys (maurice, danny, nelson, bernie and mark) are helpful, kind and cheerful. It's really nice that they remember me by name and do what they can to take of me. It is a welcoming environment and is a nice place to be when away from home. The location is great since there are many good resturants very near. Several of them are within walking distance. After my long days at the office it's nice to just come and crash in my room. Once i get there i know i have no worries. I also am able to get in good workouts while i'm there. The equipment provided is updated and working. They have a varity of equipent to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noisy A/C”
Reviews.Author: janesanjose
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, parking is on a high rise structure next to hotel, and they charge separately for the parking ( it varies weekends or weekday). The room and beds were very comfortable, spacious and they felt clean. Bathroom nice. However, the A/C was loud, it sounded like a car starting. If it was not the noise of the A/C sleep would be good and I would be back

Reviews.Title: “Operational Efficiency"”
Reviews.Author: Brectenwald
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to this Hotel for work for almost a full year. It is convenient to the office, the staff is always friendly and efficient. They work together and always have a warm greeting, as well as interest to make sure we have what we need. It is valuable to have someone like Eduardo and his peers alert to make sure items get handled: Check-in, Room service, Business Center, luggage, opening doors, and Valet parking. The Consistent quality and execution is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: cyclesweetie17
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for three years now and it really is home away from home. Dexter greets me by name and celebrates my arrival. He truely makes me smile at the end of a long day. Eduardo ensures he has reserved the room I like best and even comes out to the door when he sees me coming. At the end of each work day, Eduardo asks how my day was and makes me laugh we a funny comment. In the morning Danny and Maurice ensure the car is brought around so I don't have to wait and ensure my day is started out smooth. Laura in the conceierge lounge has fresh fruit, coffee and my favorite creamer ready to start my day and remembers me by name. Previously I stayed at the Marriott, right around the corner but the Hilton staff show the personal involvement in my day and really make this my home away from home..

Reviews.Title: “Eduardo is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bruxzee
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Hilton Woodland Hills. The Hotel is nice and the service overall is good. Eduardo at the front desk is fantastic. He makes every stay a pleasant "homelike" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always top-notch”
Reviews.Author: Rateyjane
Reviews.Content: Third stay at this hotel in the last couple of years. Always nice, receptive. Exceptional front desk staff. Rooms clean, fresh. I never hesitate to book this hotel when traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel staff are here at the Hilton Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: kathy_beaver
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel over 100 nights a year. The evening front desk staff is the best anywhere - friendly yet professional, quick, efficient - they really give it 110%. My favorite front desk person is Eduardo Villanveva - always happy, concerned about the guests, he works so hard to make sure all is taken care of. As a frequent guest it makes a huge difference to me that he makes sure I get a room I like and he even watches out to make sure that I have arrived from the airport late at night - he is absolutely the best and one of the main reasons I continue to stay at the Hilton. The valet staff are wonderful - Danny, Glenn, Maurice, Dexter - they are kind, quick, helpful and gentleman - always opening the car door and carrying the luggage up the steps. Being a frequent guest at this hotel I see the true side of the employees and this is what I know - they are kind, caring, professional, funny - they make me feel special and like I am family.

Reviews.Title: “The service and welcoming atmosphere at this hotel is great.”
Reviews.Author: veaton
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business and always look forward to coming back to the Hilton Woodland Hills/Los Angeles where I feel very welcomed by the staff, many of whom, like Eduardo Villanueva at the Front Desk, even remember my name. Everyone from the Valet parking, Front Desk, Concierge Lounge, and Breakfast restaurant staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable, I can always depend on a good night's sleep. The fitness room is also well appointed, however, it can sometimes be hard to get a machine in the early morning hours when everyone is trying to get in a workout before leaving for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Near the top for average business traveler”
Reviews.Author: fubar4
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night and was granted a complimentary suite upgrade even though I hadn't stayed at a Hilton in years. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Rooms were clean, water was hot, water pressure good and free buffet was above average. Parking was $14 per night...I still feel parking charges like this are a ripoff I would stay here again if given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Mominmaryland2010
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this very convenient Hilton location in Canoga Park. It's kind of hidden, but in a key spot. Easy to find and near lots of restaurants and shopping! We stayed close to family nearby and it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was moldy”
Reviews.Author: HeleneG51
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hilton twice a year. The room smelled of mold and if I ahd been staying more than one night i would have requested a new room. I had to use my ashtma inhaler several times at night.

Reviews.Title: “I would have expected better from "Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: roadlesstraveled13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, about the only good thing I can say was the Valet and the Bellmen were very nice. The front desk staff were mostly quite rude especially "Patricia". We called and asked for a map of the surrounding area and were told to come to the desk and get one if we wanted it, they were not going to do anything to accomodate, usually if you call the desk for anything they send someone up to your room to bring it to you, not here, you have to go to the desk wait in line for it. RUDE!! Housekeeping was the worse. Seemed like everytime we left our rooms and came back we had to have our room cards reprogrammed. When asked why this kept happening we were told "it could be a million different things" . Good answer Hilton!! We did the self parking which didn't work most of the time and had to get that card replaced twice. More inconvenience than convenience. Houseleepink took all the linens off the bed and didn't replace them for three hours, had to ask them to empty the trash not once but twice. Then at the end of our stay seems they found an additional $100 to add to our bill for "incidentals". Too bad we couldn't charge them for all the incidentals they caused, they would have ended up paying for our stay. Definitely won't recommend this place to friends!! Also if you are going to allow pets, someone should pick up after the dogs if the owner isn't, stepped in dog poop twice walking across the grass in the front. BEWARE OF THE LAND MINES!

Reviews.Title: “Crawling wireless internet speed”
Reviews.Author: laopu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and we are a little bit underwhelmed. The hotel needs a major renovation. Though the room we stayed has an LCD TV and the view is fine, it is more like a hampton inn rather than a Hilton. Since it is a Hilton, so they charge a fee for interenet access. But the wireless connection is so poor that we constantly had to reconnect and the speed is almost like a dialup. When we switched to the wired internet access, they charged us twice for the same day. The ice machine on 8th floor is broken. We will find a better option next time.

Reviews.Title: “These people do not care about you”
Reviews.Author: UncleRMC
Reviews.Content: We use Priceline regularly and get some pretty nice places to stay, Staybridge Suites in Chatsworth or Embassy Suites Santa Clarita. This time we were sent to the Hilton Woodland Hills. As usual we call the hotel immediately to make our specific reservations for bed selections. This call is made 2 WEEKS before we are to arrive. When I called the Hilton they REFUSED to talk to me. I explained that doing this is recommended by Priceline and that I have done this dozens of times. I requested a room with 2 queen beds. She refused to discuss and told me that I would have to wait until I arrived at the hotel to make these arrangements. We are driving from Oregon to Los Angeles and after getting a late start and hitting traffic in Sacramento and having a 7pm appointment to meet I decide to call again and try to make arrangements so that we can go right to our room and get to our appointment on time. This time, for the first time, I am told that they have NO QUEEN BEDS in the entire hotel. WHAT??? It's me, my wife and teenage daughter and the choice is 2 doubles or a king. OK, I'll pay to upgrade to a suite. What? The sofa is not a sofa bed? Do you think the people on the phone with me would try to be helpful? Boy would you be wrong. No help and no suggestions. Just tough sh!t that's the way it is. When we arrive I explain the situation again. Nothing....just blank stares. I ask for a roll-a-way bed for our teenager and they will check "to see" if any are available. Maybe the person on the phone could have suggested this and made SURE they had one? We read online that a lot of people mentioned a free breakfast and went down in the morning "assuming" that the very small buffet was for guests. Guess again, the crappy breakfast for 3 came to $40!!!!! So we are at check out and I know the manager of this Hilton likes to read and reply on Tripadvisor so as the gentleman at the desk is telling me the total on my bill.....I say, "aren't you going to ask me how my stay was?" Blank stares. This guy could care less. I mention the bed situation, the phone calls, the hassles....but nicely and quietly so as to not have other guests that were checking in hear me.....I was not trying to embarrass anyone. Nothing. Blank stares. So I say, "I saw online that many people did not have to pay $40 for the pretty skimpy breakfast. I was surprised to pay?" He looked at me and said in a monotone, "Not included in your package." No free breakfast. No free internet. No free parking. No pool. No caring employees. Wow, Mr. Manager, write anything you want in response. Tell me how sorry you are for the lousy time I had at your establishment. I know you do not care. Your employees are proof. Not one person I spoke to had any interest in making my 2 day stay at your hotel anything close to a pleasant experience. Talk is cheap. This is the worst review I've ever had to write about any hotel or restaurant. It's one thing when things "just go wrong", but in this case your employees had no interest in me or my family. You are in the hospitality business and showed us NONE. This is also a reflection on Priceline. They should never send anyone to this establishment and I have written to them too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an LA suburb”
Reviews.Author: moo
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri/Sat/Sun nights at this hotel for the second part of our trip to LA. We wanted an hotel not too far from the LA buzz but on the quite side. The hotel seemed to tick those boxes, plus it had a great rate on offer if pre-booked in advance. Upgraded to their executive double which gave us free in room wifi, breakfast etc. Unlike previous reviews, I did not have any issues with the hotel's decor. The parking charge, which I assume is because the hotel doesn't own the parking structure, is reduced at weekends. There is a direct link to the hotel. A number of restaurants nearby including cheesecake factory. On the plus side for us was the Westfield shopping mall + other shops nearby as well. I was impressed by the care and attention afforded by the staff of this hotel, particularly the saturday and sunday morning staff serving breakfast. One of the ladies stood out because she made sure she engaged with customers. She even remembered our coffee and juice orders from the previous day. My only complaint was that the double bed seemed to be on the small side. I would definitely stay here again if I needed an hotel in a similar area.

Reviews.Title: “not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizH1174
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton during the week of Aug 8th - 14th. The hotel staff was friendly, rooms were clean and ok..not really anything special. I stayed in the basic king room. I had picked this hotel because it was close to the conference I was attending...so on that point alone, it was ok....there were several there, with families/kids who changed hotels after staying one night. The Hilton does not have a pool, does not have free internet, does not have free over night parking and does not have mini refridg. in rooms...so if these things are important to you, I would pick another hotel. There are many restaurant's close to the Hilton....most just out the front door and 1/2 block away. The Cheescake Factory, Morton's, BJ's Restaurant and Brewery. Starbucks, Jamba Juice and a few burger places are about 1 block away. I did find the best place to have breakfast and it's VERY inexpensive.....right next door to the Hilton, at 6400 Canoga, on the first floor of the office building, in Suite 118 is a very small place called SWEET HOUSE CAFE. they have great breakfasts, eggs, bagels, fruit, etc., and for lunch, all kinds of sandwiches and salads....they are open only until 4:00 PM...but worth the stop and very inexpensive. Check out from the Hilton was easy..no issues...overall the Hilton is a fine hotel, if you don't want the frills and thrills ....basic hotel, lounge, etc.....I would stay again, BUT not if I were to bring my family.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bridgetpianos
Reviews.Content: Staying 12 days on business.This Hotel is a beautiful hotel and very clean. You pay for Valet parking but they are so polite friendly and fast .The front desk staff are so helpful directions etc. There is a restaurant but seemed always empty so I had dinner at the many different retaurants close by.In the next block is the cheese factory. The consierge's level has snacks from 5 to 9 and breakfast and has a nice view.The house keeper was very good so everything was great just a little over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of Hilton name”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: This hotel i does have a great location. Immediately upon entering you feel the understated design and substandard decor, lack of color. Certainly, it could be said the decor is to be of Asian origin, however, whomever designed this lobby and the color selections did not represent the best for the property. I found the property to be outdated in every aspect, from the rooms, the lobby and the restaurant. The lounge did seem to be more updated than any other location within the hotel. The front desk staff were friendly, the bell staff were purely average and not in what one would expect of a Hilton uniform. The price point of the hotel would allow you to expect something more than what you are getting and I would strongly suggest visiting another hotel instead of the Woodland Hills Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with good room service!”
Reviews.Author: letstalktravel
Reviews.Content: I saved 35% by booking on hotwire (orig $125 for Saturday night) We checked in very late but was still able to get our 2 bed room with no hassles. We were on the 10th floor. Beds are very comfortable with 4 pillows on each bed! Room service is till 10:30pm/11:00pm. Rosemary chicken was YUMMY! Toiletries were splendid! I really enjoy my weekend stay here. ONLY DOWNFALL - you have to pay for parking ($7 as a guest) because its a shared parking structure with like 6 other buildings and businesses.

Reviews.Title: “The valet attendants service was great even though for the price of the rooms ,it should be complimentary”
Reviews.Author: ibari210
Reviews.Content: Changed rooms 3 times on the same day-room lights were dysfunctional Housekeeping attitude was very poor and not customer focused Front desk were not good at answering phones within 15 rings or listening to customers needs No complimentary water in room. No free Wifi in this day and age. General poor customer focus The best part of the stay was that the valet attendants were great with the customers especially the evening shift on weekends.(Nelson). The location was ideal to shopping. The gym was great

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton located in a quiet corner of the San Fernando Valley.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley25NorCal
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what one expects from a full-service Hilton. We stayed Easter weekend so it was pretty quiet at this business-travel-oriented hotel. Nice area in the San Fernando Valley yet still reasonably accessible to downtown LA. Only drawback encountered: the room ran out of hot water on Monday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Fun_n_Travelin
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and understand "Good Customer Service". The Hilton in Woodland Hills, California really impressed me with their positive attitude and respectful treatment of their guests!!! The hotel was clean and the amenities were good, but it is the "Great Attitudes" that have left me with a fantastic memory of my trip there. You can see it is February of 2010 and I still reflect on that hotel staff with a smile and happy thoughts (I stayed there in June of 2009). If you are traveling in the area and get a chance to stay there, then do it!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hilton experience...”
Reviews.Author: noelwhit
Reviews.Content: I stay here at least 3-5 times a month... it is ALWAYS a pleasure in every way. Staff is very courteous and helpful, rooms are neat and clean and even the room service food is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: bostonsig
Reviews.Content: I was on business traveling to Northridge and stayed at the Hilton Woodland Hills. The room was perfect with a great view of the mountains (newly covered in snow) and the staff was top notch. The hotel is near the highways so it's easy on/off to wherever you need to get to. Additionally there are plenty of restaurants and shops very close by. I enjoyed a peaceful night sleep in a very clean and pleasant atmosphere both nights. I'd highly recommend the hotel (you can pre-pay for your parking which I suggest you do at the front desk at check in).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Very Helpful Staff/Clean, Oversized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jbttags
Reviews.Content: They offered a great holiday rate, (we stayed on New Years Day). Staff was very helpful at check-in .... upgraded our rooms because of the extended family we had traveling with us. It was within walking distance to nearby restaurants and shops. We were traveling to the Getty the next day, and the hotel was in a great location for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: nhobby
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute reservation to stay on New Years Eve to attend a party. Everything was ready for us when we arrive. Friendly staff greeted us. I would stay there again and plan on it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ~ Easy Access to The Rose Bowl”
Reviews.Author: OregonKK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton in Woodland Hills and we were very pleased. We drove in from Fresno to attend the Rose Bowl, Oregon vs. Ohio State. It was easy to find and we chose it for its easy 20 mile straight shot to Pasadena. Very nice accommodations, we had a great king room on the corner with a nice view of the hills and the price per night was really reasonable for the New Year/Rose Bowl time frame. Woodland Hills is a sweet little area just NW of Hollywood and Universal Studios is very close. The Hilton location in Woodland Hills offered great places to eat nearby and a huge shopping center within walking distance. Woodland Hills is clean and feels safe. We will definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great business center, good location for the valley”
Reviews.Author: Sounder999
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms and spacious lobby. Available business center. only there for one short night so I did not try the fitness center. Little goodies like 3 mile shuttle service are helpful. Very convenient for the nearby malls. The free breaksfast in the executive lounge is fair

Reviews.Title: “The Valley Works for Me”
Reviews.Author: 49North122West
Reviews.Content: For training, we stayed at this property and I was impressed by the professionalism and cleanliness. I even moved furniture and bedding around to peak underneath! Training was a quick walk even better was my first time ever on the transit system. I took the Orange Line to North Hollywood and went further to Union Station (had lunch at Felipe's) and then off to Santa Monica on the 720 bus. In all my years in S. Cal, I never thought I would be on transit--but I loved it! Better yet was coming back to Canoga and walking 2 minutes to the hotel. If in the Valley, I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Woodland Hills and in the Wester San Fernando Valley”
Reviews.Author: Flyintl
Reviews.Content: I liked my weekend stay at this hotel. The Concierge Floor room was adequate and furnished sufficiently. The staff at the front desk and the restaurant staff are very sincere and nice (weekend breakfast is a buffet with made to order omelettes and waffles) which is a great choice. While this isn't the best hotel I've stayed at, it's a good choice when in the Woodland Hills / Western San Fernando Valley area. The large and upscale shopping mall is just a few minutes drive and there are many resaurants nearby. Yes, you have to pay for parking and learning how to use one parking ticket to get in and out as many times as you want takes a little learning, but the staff are very accommodating in teaching you how. I'm a Hilton HHonors Diamond member (top tier) and the upgrade and free full weekend breakfast were very nicely provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: hempist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton many times. It's right next door to the Cheesecake Factory and BJ's Brewery which is really convenient. There's also many fast food restaurants and shopping nearby. The people who work at this Hilton are always very friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and they have nice, big, flat screen TV's. Once they had cold water in the lobby with lemons, limes, and oranges floating in it, it was so good but I've never seen it again. I wish they had it every day! One thing you should know about this hotel is that they charge $14 a day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Hilton, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: shorty1234
Reviews.Content: Also, the parking garage is a joke, the hotel will charge you $14-15/day and you will have problems with your in and out privileges. I had three separate occasions where I had to get another card each time. Customer service is a bigger joke. I travel extensively for business, and would not stay at this hotel again. Also, the housekeeping staff does not change out the travel size mouthwash (mine did not have a safety seal on it and it was half full).

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: daverainh2o
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property many times over the years and it is a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay. What you should expect form a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: glaubscher
Reviews.Content: Was reccomended by my company to stay here and was quite pleased with the hotal and staff. Room Service was prompt and food was hot and tasty

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: RocketRoamer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times before and this was the best visit. The staff were great. I was pleased to see that they improved their breakfast they were offering. They had a chef making omletes of every variety and waffles in addition to the full breakfast buffet they have had before. I also was in a pinch they helped me with. I had left behind my computer and they helped me get it back to me without any trouble. I had to use my own shipping account of course, but they boxed it up for me and sent it off. The staff there did a fantastic job and I survived the trip just fine. The staff was very courteous the whole trip and even afterward. The only bad part was that the parking garage elevator wasn't working right, but it is managed by a different company. I think the door sensor was out. Hopefully they get that fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, especially if you're disabled”
Reviews.Author: LAKen2
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my disabled mother to this hotel and requested an accessible room. The room was a decent size and very accomodating to someone who is physically challenged; however, the room was dirty. I found a clump of long brown hair in the shower drain and the same hair on the top towel in the bathroom. It appeared that the towel had been used by the previous guest and then had been re-folded (by housekeeping?) and placed back on the rack. I cleaned the bathroom myself and was determined to have a good stay. However, when I was wheeling my mother outside of the hotel, down the ramp, one of the bellboys had placed a cart at the bottom of the ramp and we couldn't get past it. I had to move it myself as no one was there. To make matters worse, once I had my mother loaded into the car, the parking attendant wouldn't move another car out of my way so that I could turn around and told me to back the car out of the driveway instead. As anyone knows who has ever assisted a disabled person, the job is already difficult without having hotel staff making it harder. I booked this hotel through Priceline and due to this horrible stay, I will never use Priceline again. I have sworn off Priceline despite having enjoyed stays at the Woodland Hills Marriott and Staybridge Suites Chatsworth. I just can't take the chance that I will be assigned to this Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Canoga Park”
Reviews.Author: thutwoez
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice, all my accomodations were as advertised. I definitely would stay here if I traveled to this area again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: Melissa1973
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very clean and welcoming after a long day of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: maluvsart
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that should have been an easy stay due to its location. First, the reservation clerk made no mention that parking was $14 overnight. The parking lot is behind the hotel with no direct connection making it difficult for a handicapped person. The valet area was blocked by parked cars. I had requested a non smoking room with a kingsize bed near the elevator. I was given the LAST room farthest from the elevator wreaking of smoke. They advertise a non smoking hotel. The halls are stuffy and hot. When we complained we were given three keys to "try" different rooms. We played find the room for about a half hour with our luggage in tow and finally we got a fresh room but not near the elevator. No frig and no microwave. The coffee pot barely worked and we found the beds uncomfortable and the pillowcases were rough. It's evident the staff struggles. If you don't care about comfort, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but outdated rooms and facilities”
Reviews.Author: SFLeonce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Woodland Hills every week from March through June on business and am very disappointed with the quality of the rooms and facilities. The entire hotel is old, smelly and in need of an upgrade. The rooms smell as if they have been smoking-rooms before and only recently been converted to non-smoking (the odor seems to stick to the thick, old, golden carpet). Every week something was broken in every room I stayed in (shower, shower curtain, TV, air condition, Internet). The elevators are probably the slowest have ever seen and the wait can be very long, especially in the morning. The fitness center is very small and ill equipped, and the bar and the restaurant are below average. But, the staff is great, very friendly, very helpful, very attentive. The have been able to fix every problem in short time and are very understanding when things go wrong. Great attitude and always with a smile. Without them, this hotel would have gotten two stars from me.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the San Fernado Valley”
Reviews.Author: David_Marks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in most of the hotels in the valley and found that the Hilton was the best for allaround service, comfort and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Cares very much about your stay”
Reviews.Author: 4poster
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel deserves an excellent grade. The parking is easy, check in fast and courteous. Room was comfortable, clean, quiet and well appointed. We had one gripe with the dinner service which was being served in the lounge/bar. After filling out a review, I was immediately contact by the F&B Director of the hotel and she indicated that she would have the problem fixed. That is great customer service. This is an elegant hotel in a great neighborhood which we got for a very reasonable rate. Easy freeway access - but not so close as to be a noise issue. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So, uh, Where's my Polo Blue Perfume?”
Reviews.Author: lawyergirl07
Reviews.Content: My assistant and I traveled to Woodland Hills for a brief over night trip with a super important meeting in the morning. I booked the Woodland Hills Hilton off of Priceline for 65 dollars a night which wasnt bad for the area. We arrived around 530pm after fighting several hours of traffic. The drive was a very hard to maneuver with a large SUV which made the very pleasant and helpful Valet guy an awesome person to know. The inside lobby was like a desert, hot and stuffy yet empty. The lone receptionist checked us in quickly. When we turned to head for the elevators, my assistant nearly tripped over a garbage can (yes, a trash can...with trash in it even!!) sitting in the middle of the walk way. After further curiousity, we noticed that the garbage can was sitting there catching a drip from somewhere in the ceiling. We made out way down the dark and dreary hallway to our room which was nothing spectacular. Two full sized beds, ugly dirty carpet, a beat up desk and the bathroom resembled the one from the original Psycho. I began to work on some stuff for my meeting and she turned on the television that we believe was purchased from the Smithsonian. A few hours into our stay, I decided to get take-out from the BJs Brewery located directly next door. I stood in front of the elevator for 10 minutes. Nothing. So, I used the little courtesy telephone to call the front desk to inform them that the elevators were not working. The problem: The lady placed me on hold before I was even able to tell her something was wrong. So, I stood there for another 10 minutes waiting on hold and for the elevator, whichever came first. The same issue happened on the way back, though other guests were not nearly as nice about it as I. On the day of check out and my meeting, I had arranged for a wake up call. The call never came and I found myself rushing to get there on time. In the process, I left a bottle of my favorite perfume. Realizing my mistake, I called the hotel directly after my meeting, while i was relatively close to the hotel. The gentleman responsible for the lost and found was rude and told me that nothing had been found. I went through all of my luggage and my assistant went through her's just in case and nothing. Nada. Zip. So, I called back and his exact words were "I dont know what to tell ya." WHAT?! I was angry and called the Hotel Manager who coincidentally had been able to locate my perfume which was not registered into the lost and found. She promised to send it to my home and guess what...I still have yet to receive it!

Reviews.Title: “Another week in Woodland Hills”
Reviews.Author: wcokeley
Reviews.Content: The elevators have improved but it doesn't seem like they all work. Some of the fitness equipment was not functioning properly. Overall it is a nice property but it seems more like a $129 a night place not a $189. This time my AC unit was working but I have had to contact maintenance the previous two stays.

Reviews.Title: “The service and cleanliness was excellent”
Reviews.Author: bonus21
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at the Hilton was great. The service and cleanliness was excellent. The friendliness and helpfullness of the staff was much appreciated. The rooms are cozy, and the quality of the bed and pillows made sleeping extremely pleasant. My only complaint would be the breakfast in the morning. Though the service was being excellent, the breakfast qaulity was below average as well as overpriced. Overall my experiance was great. I will be staying at this hotel in the future, just not eating breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasure staying at the hilton”
Reviews.Author: bubbeNewYork
Reviews.Content: purhaps a little more local knowledge with the people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: jn_nielson
Reviews.Content: We arrived prior to the check in time, but the staff was able to get us into rooms with no waiting. The original rooms that we requested were not available but they were comperable and still wonderful rooms to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience.”
Reviews.Author: Gotthetravelbug81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton on 3/20/09. We live in Ventura, but my husband had a class in Encino on Friday evening and Saturday, so we decided it would be a good idea to stay in a hotel to eliminate the commute. We used the "name your own price" feature on Priceline and won the Hilton for $54.00 per night! This was a 50% discount compared to booking through the hotel directly. I was extremely nervous about staying at the Hilton since the reviews are below average. The parking is a little inconvenient, but worked out fine. Self-parking is $14.00 per day. Valet is $19.00. I called to inform the front desk we would be checking in late (10:30 p.m.). Check-in was quick and the receptionist was friendly. My only complaint, and the reason why I am giving the review a 4 instead of a 5, is our room had two double beds. My husband and I were too tired to go back down and request a room with a king bed, plus we weren’t sure if there were any rooms available with a king bed. The bed was definitely small. The room itself was very large and clean. The bathroom was also an average size and clean. The showerhead had great water pressure. Our room was directly across from the elevator, but we never heard any noise from it. The Hilton is located right next to a Cheesecake Factory, BJ’s Brewery and Morton’s. It is also in driving distance to the Topanga and Promenade Mall, a movie theater, and Ruth’s Chris. I was very pleased with our stay at the Hilton. I would definitely stay here again if we were able to use Priceline, but I also feel the rate of $109 (if we had booked directly) would have been fair. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: milril44
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms are large and basic. Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries were nice. Two computers for guest use in the lobby. Valets for parking were plentiful and eager. The hotel restaurant had good breakfast potatoes and OJ. Towels were fluffy and plentiful. Many places to sit in lobby. Located within walking distance to shops, Westfield mall and restaurants. Cons: Twice there was the smell of cigarette smoke from an adjacent room through the bathroom vent, even though we specifically had a room on a non-smoking floor. Had to complain to the front desk twice about it. No safe in the room. They charge $14 for daily self parking and $19 for valet parking! The walls are too thin, noise can be heard from hallway and other rooms. TV volume is either too loud or too soft, no in between.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Hilton Standards”
Reviews.Author: kitzklan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on a recent visit to CA. We booked it on Hotwire and chose it because of the 3.5 star rating. This is a 3.5 star rated hotel only becuase of the Hilton name. The hotel was clean but there was nothing special about the rooma nd the service left a lot to be desired. The fact that there was no pool on site is also a negative. Parking is very inconvenient and confusing and costs $14 per day if you self park and $19 if you valet park. We self parked and listened to the valet parking people squeal tires each time we walked to our car. Use of the validated parking tickets was not fully explained and very inconvenient. After several trips to the front desk I finally got someone to explain the procedure. Interesting part about customer service is that the words "sorry" or "I apologize" do not seem to be part of their vocabulary. Another downer was the fact that internet is $10 a day. I had to spend 30 minutes on the phone to get it to work and was told by one person at he front desk that it was complimentary before having a tech person come to the room to get it working and then have to pay the $10 per day to use it. Overall a negative experience for a Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the Hilton brand”
Reviews.Author: Robsteray
Reviews.Content: I like Hilton's, but this one is really not up to par of a hotel of this implied caliber. I have been staying here since Nov 2007 to just recently when I decided I had enough and am trying a few more hotels The best service in the entire hotel are the Valets who park your car. The rest of the staff goes about their duties with the enthusiam comperable of preparing to go in for a root canal. This hotel knows they do quite a solid business with the Warner Center nearby. The location provides people who will stay regardless of the lack of service. They have no incentive to improve. The Rooms: Are nice. The bedding is comfortable and nice pillows. I never saw bed bugs indicated in some of the other reviews and I looked for signs of them everytime. I did however have an alleric reaaction to something in the sheets on occasion. Detergent perhaps? The air conditioners need work. I'm not sure how old they were, but I called maintenance often and there is really not much they could do. Housekeeping often turns them off to save energy, which is great, but on sunny days those rooms heat up. Housekeeping: A joke. the only thing consistent in their cleaning is their inconsistency. I wouldn't touch the glassware, I've found everything from lipstick to coffee on/in the mugs. They do well on the towels, but replacing soap/shampoo/etc leaves much to be desired. I don't think the vacum daily. Internet: Well because it's a hilton and a "Little" more up scale they do charge for it. Not a big deal, but the system speed is different everytime I stayed. I'm not sure if that's due to bandwith of the number of hotel guests users or it's just different between the floors. Workout Facility: Nice, better than most. Water dispenser doesn't always work, but thats really about it. Lifetime fitness will let you workout for $15 and is right next door if you're a serious workout seeker. Executive floor: Nothing really special. The rooms are pretty much like the other rooms, they have slighly nicer bathrooms. The lounge provides a continental breakfast and PM snack. Alcohol is only served in the bar, and if you have status you can get drink coupons. Neighborhood: Great Shopping withing 1/2 mile, Starbucks and cheesecake factory very close by makes it a great location. Overall: If you need Hilton points and you can handle a hotel with some issues you know about going in it's fine. If you want more, There is a marriott nearby. If you like hilton, but have more time I'd stay at the Hilton Garden inn in Calabasas or the Homewood Suites in Agoura. More of a drive, but a better experience at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of All Time”
Reviews.Author: fuzzykriden
Reviews.Content: I booked a King room and they gave me a room with two twin beds. The front desk told me they were out of King rooms and couldn't give me one. However, if I wanted to pay additional fees they would put me in a room with a King bed. That is confusing to say the least and I have never encountered this at any other hotel. They also failed to help give any information about the confusing parking at this hotel. I was appalled by the squeaky springs in the bed and the loudest flushing toilet I have ever heard. Overall this was a terrible night,I got no sleep in the dorm sized bed the night before my best friends wedding. I will never stay at any Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “i think this hotel gave me bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: caterwauler
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great, to be honest. But I have since discovered a bed bug infestation in my apartment. I have not stayed ANYWHERE else in the past 6 months, other than with family who have confirmed they don't have bed bugs. I called to ask management if they've ever had bed bug infestations and they said they hadn't. Then I read the older review from June about them. Hotels lie, lie, lie! I don't know, you can get bed bugs at any hotel apparently. But let's just say I won't be staying here again. :(...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: saeColorado
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff could not "find" my reservation. I booked a night at $109 online and they would not honor that price. Instead they wanted to charge $179. When I asked to speak to a manger, both girls at the desk laughed in my face. I ended up staying in a much nicer and friendlier hotel nearby. I have stayed at the Hilton Woodland Hills with my family several times in the past couple of years, but after this experience I will not stay there again and do not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boro_expat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton Woodland Hills for two nights whilst touring California. We used it as a base to visit LA. Hotel check in and reception staff were first class. Very quick and efficient. Good size room. Air conditioning unit was a little noisy. The hotel was generally in a good state of repair. Parking is to the rear of the hotel in a multu-storey car park. It's a few minutes walk, so it's a good idea to drop off any luggage at the hotel before parking. The restaurant always seemed totally empty, so it put us off going in there. In general the hotel was clean, rooms were a good size, staff were efficient and we felt that our stay was good value.

Reviews.Title: “$10 for internet access”
Reviews.Author: KCinKY
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for a training class and the company arranged my stay at the Hilton in Woodland Hills. The hotel is clean. The employees are helpful. My bed is very comfortable, the sheets are high quality. The temperature of the room is easy to control. There is no free high speed internet access. I am a Hilton Hhonors member and expected to get that service for free, but I was informed that it was still $9.95 a day. I think that is rediculous for a hotel that is supposed to be for business travelers. The restaurant is adequate. There is a bar onsite with entertainment some nights. I read in the hotel directory that there is lounge with breakfast and happy hour for hilton hhonors members on the 14th floor, but when I called to asked about it, it was only for gold or platinum members. Why would you advertise that if it was only for the select few? If I had to pay for my stay here, I certainly wouldn't choose it. There must be places just as comfortable that offer more for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sueysoo
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pleasent and the rooms were very clean.The price per night was great considering it was Labor Day weekend. The Valet staff and housekeeping were very accomedating and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline = Rude Front Desk Reception”
Reviews.Author: sdtraveler33
Reviews.Content: We needed a place a stay following a wedding and since we were making an early AM departure --- we weren't too picky. We heard of a winning priceline bid for this hotel for the same date we were staying and booked the room through priceline at a great rate. Having used priceline before, I am aware that you don't necessarily get your choice of smoking/non-smoking or king/double/single. But, I always believe it is absolutely foolish for a hotel to offer rooms on priceline then treat winning bidders rudely --- which is exactly what this hotel went out of their way to do. First, the hotel must have been vacant. We booked last minute for $55. Everywhere else in LA was considerably more. Our friends booked rooms the traditional way the night before. When we called in advance to ask if we could possibly check in early, Rita (the front desk receptionist) looked up our reservation and said --- come to the hotel and we'll see. By the time we got to the hotel at 1:30pm, some of our friends (who did not book on priceline) had already checked in. Rita told us we had been preassigned to a room and that it would not be ready for an hour or two. While she is telling us this --- other people are checking in with the other front desk receptionist. I told Rita that we have to get ready for a wedding and any room will do --- we are not picky. She said that there are absolutely no rooms available. At this time our friends returned from their rooms and told us the maids have just cleaned the rooms near them. Rita told us that all rooms are preassigned and we were assigned a specific room. I asked her to switch and she said it was impossible. Rita was genuinely going out of her way to be rude to us and sincerely did not want allow us to check-in or wanted to ensure we got a bad room. After expressing shock that they would not allow us a room, but allowed four groups of our friends to check in (and knowing that the hotel is not sold-out) and after Rita continuously telling us there is no way --- I asked to speak to a manager. Rita then spent 5 minutes browsing her computer and 10 minutes in the back room before she returned and said there was a room available. The room we received was not a special room --- on floor 9 (out of 15) right next to the ice machine. It was two double beds --- although we told her we preferred a king --- we were fine and didn't complain. I was shocked that she was holding this room back and didn't offer to us when we asked --- it wasn't an upgraded room. As Rita gave us the keys --- it was as if she had been defeated. She was quick and rude about it. If the Hilton Woodland Hills doesn't want Priceline guests --- they shouldn't put their rooms on Priceline. I didn't care where I stayed. The only thing that Rita's treatment did was to ensure that when I have to pick a particular hotel and book traditionally, I will not return to this hotel. BTW, the thermostat in the room is programmed to restrict the temperature from going below 75 degrees (despite the fact that it was over 100 outside) during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Room Infested by Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Jake35
Reviews.Content: I spend 6 nights at the Hilton Woodland Hills in June 2007 (room 307). The room, hotel, amenities, etc seemed ok. Slightly dingy, but otherwise not bad. After the first night, I noticed a rash on my body that seemed like an alergic reaction to something. It got worse each day. I thought I was either allergic to the soap, shampoo or the laundry detergent used on the sheets or towels, but this had never happened to me before. I bought new soap and shampoo (brands I normally use). The rash was worse in the mornings, and appeared to be be in rows of several inches on various parts of my body (legs, abdomen, back, chest, etc). I started to research what it could be, and all signs seemed to indicated bed bugs. I finally stripped off my sheets and mattress and found a single bed bug (a flat brown bug about the size of a tick) crawling around between the mattress and box spring. I didn't bother looking for more. I immediately called the front desk. They sent a security manager with a camera. He was sympathetic, but neither confirmed nor denied anything. He photographed my rashes, took the bug, and offered me a new room on the executive floor. My main concern was to not track these home with me. They offered to dry clean all of my clothes, which I took them up on. I also asked them to spray down my suitcase with pesticide. As it was getting late on a Fri evening, the best they could do was to produce a can of pesticide, and I sprayed all my bags down myself. Overall, I think the hotel responded reasonably well. They should have offered to pick up the hotel tab, but didn't, and didn't provide any other compensation. I would have protested more, but I was being reimbursed by my company for the trip. The second room was clean of bed bugs, but I kept waking up at night and checking under the covers. While the hotel seems relatively clean, it was a very disapointing stay. I will not return. The Marriott is close by, and I've no had problems like this over there. I travel to Woodland Hills frequently for work.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough Hotel In A Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: sulitster
Reviews.Content: I have only stayed for one night and find that this hotel will meet everyone's expectation of a worry free accomodation. Check-in was fast, rooms were clean and maintained, fast elevators, clean hallway, and definitely a safe neighborhood. I've got the room thru PRICELINE and got a great deal for the one night I stayed. Although I must say, that if I have to pay what they normally charged $99 and above, I will not choose this hotel. Simply because, they charge extra for everything. They charge for local calls, internet, parking and breakfast. I can get the same outstanding rooms and location elsewhere for the same price or maybe even less, but with more amenities included. Wake up HILTON, you are not the only game in town.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after winning a Priceline bid for $59 a night. We felt we were given the Priceline treatment after my wife and I were assigned a room with two single beds. This was after I explicitly asked the desk clerk to add my wife to the record in case she needed help at the front desk. After going back to the front desk for a change, we were given a 5th floor room with a queen bed. The place was suitable considering I was in the area for a business meeting, and had some social events scheduled nearby. My wife enjoyed the nearby shopping, and there were good restaurants in the area. I would use valet parking, as the parking garage is about a one block walk. The restaurant in the hotel was nothing to write home about. They offered a breakfast buffet for $11 per person, but we passed on it when we looked at the offerings and the fact that no one else was in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: GladeVandrer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and found the hotel to be kind of old. Room looked old, the lobby and elevators as well. The place looked kind of nice from the outside anyway. The room was clean and the beds were comfy - the most important thing for me anyway. The area was quiet, and not any sights or points of interest nearby. I paid about $100 for the room and found that to be quite okay. Normally this hotel is much more expensive, and I don't think I'd recommend this hotel at $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tindc
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this Hilton. The rooms were very nice, staff was friendly and helpful and overall everything went great. I had friends staying in other hotels and their stays were not as pleasant as mine! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler79
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay here during a convention a few weeks ago. The rooms were very nice and clean. My only real complaint is that you had to pay for certain services such as parking and wireless internet in your room (although there is a free business center downstairs), but this may be standard for the Hilton. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant was a bit more than I would usually pay for breakfast, but it tasted fine. The food served during the convention (which I assume was catered by the hotel) was much better than I had expected. So if you are planning a meeting here, I would recommend it. Although I would caution against dining at the Mexican restaurant down the street (can't recall the name). The food was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room...”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: I'm giving the Hilton-Woodland Hills an "above average" rating based upon the room that we were given. I had requested, at check-in, a quiet room...and my wife and I were pleased with the corner room that we received on a high floor. The room was HUGE. The furnishings and bed were above average. We stayed two nights. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant the first morning -- it was only 'fair,' so we didn't eat there the 2nd morning. Parking was easy...and the staff was nice. Again, I'm giving the "above average" rating based upon the room and service...not the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: shepdec
Reviews.Content: A while back, I received a "Fast Track" offer from Hilton Honors. The deal was that if I did six stays in a specified amount of time, I would get upgraded to a Hilton Honors Gold card. I had been a gold card holder a few years back, then after 9-11 my business travel got cut back a bit, so I slipped down to silver. I always missed my gold card, because it includes free room upgrades when available, and access to the VIP lounge. So, my wife and I set out to do six local stays. One of the hotels we chose was the Hilton Woodland Hills & Towers. Of all the hotels we tried, this was our favorite, and we made a mental note to return again. This weekend, our daughter went to go stay with Grandma, and we decided to go back to the Hilton at Woodland Hills. I don't know what happened in the few months between now and our last stay, but things really seem to have gone downhill in terms of customer service at this property. It started from the moment we pulled up. The valet parking was jammed with cars, and nobody seemed to be doing very much about it. When I was able to pull up closer to the hotel, I unloaded my own luggage. A Valet finally walked by, and asked me if I needed anything. It told him that I would like for someone to park my car. He asked if I was checking in. Apparently, pulling up to a hotel and unloading suitcases isn’t a clear enough indicator. When I explained that I was indeed checking in, he informed me that we would be charged $14.00 per day for the parking. We went inside the door to the front desk. He told us we had a king room in the towers. We went up to the 14th floor. The elevator opened across from an impressive double-door, with big gold lettering at the top that said “Concierge Lounge”. In Hilton speak, this means a nice lounge with free drinks and snacks for the towers guests. The last time we stayed at this property, we weren't yet even gold card members and we received an oversized room with a living room and separate bedroom. We hadn’t reserved a suite, so I thought that perhaps all the rooms at this property were like that. This time we had a room that wasn't any larger or nicer than an average Best Western. We were disappointed, but in fairness, the upgrades are based on availability. At least we were on the towers level and knew where to find the Concierge Lounge. We unpacked, and I set up my laptop. I connected it to the RJ14 cable provided in the room for Internet service. It didn't work. I traced the cable to behind the TV. It was connected. Then I pulled out my own cable and connected that, and it worked fine. Later, I found another cable back behind the TV that wasn't connected to anything, which is probably used when someone complains that the Internet doesn't work, instead of just fixing the cable that is connected at the desk. Next, we decided to check out the Concierge lounge. We went to the huge double doors by the elevator, and our key didn't work. There are two towers levels, so I thought maybe they had closed the one on our floor, so we went up one floor and tried that one. Still nothing. We went back to the room and called the front desk. I was informed that they no longer had a towers lounge. I asked the clerk exactly what benefit we had received by being on the Towers level. He replied, "A better view". The name Woodland Hills sounds like it might be a scenic place, but it's really not. The view was of some office buildings across the street. I told him that the last time we came, we had received a much larger room. He informed me that this was the best room they had available. I told him that I was very disappointed, and had selected this hotel based on our last experience, and so far it was like a different universe. He told me there was nothing he could do except to offer us free breakfast coupons. Then I remembered, that we had paid a higher rate to get breakfast included, and they had failed to give them to us when we checked in. I thought perhaps he would offer to knock down our rate, but it was apparent that he could care less that we were unhappy. We considered just checking out and going home. But, instead thought we would try to make the best of it. Perhaps going down to the hotel bar and having a few drinks would put a different spin on the situation. We passed by the front desk, and I asked for my free breakfast coupons. The clerk handed them over. The bar was totally empty, and we could see the bartender talking to what looked like other hotel employees. We sat down at a table near the bar. There was no acknowledgement that we had even come in. They all just kept talking. I began to wonder if the bar was closed. Finally the bartender came up and asked if we would like something. My wife ordered wine. I ordered a Tom Collins. He asked what kind of gin. I said, "what do you have". He cocked his head toward the bar. I smiled and said, "Oh, you've got a lot of 'em". He snapped back, "No, all those bottles and the mirrors behind them are just an optical illusion". I wasn't sure if he was trying to be funny, or was just rude. I told him to surprise me. He came back a while later with the drinks and a bill. No offer to run a tab. We sat and drank our drinks, and nobody ever came back to ask if we wanted another drink. I finally just signed the ticket and we walked out. We spent the rest of the night in the room, which was clean and nicely decorated. The Television had a good selection of current movies, and the Internet worked after I wired in my own cable. We ordered some desert from room service, which was good and came in a reasonable amount of time. For having been told that all the other rooms were taken, it was interesting that we never really saw anybody else on our floor. In the morning, we went to have our free breakfast. When we arrived we were seated in a corner, in a small table jammed in with strangers on all sides. It was odd, because other than this one corner the restaurant was empty. I've noticed a trend lately where they try to get you to take the breakfast buffet. I prefer to order off the menu, figuring that if I wanted to get my own food, I'd do that at home for free. The waitress made a last ditch attempt to get us to take the buffet by informing us that with the free breakfast coupon, we were limited to only $9.00 each off the menu. It didn't say that on the coupon, and most things on the menu were $9.00 or more. We ordered off the menu anyway. When we returned to the room, I tried the video check-out. After telling me to wait several minutes, it notified me that it wasn't working and I should try again later. We went down to the front desk to check out. It was the same guy who checked us in, and took my phone call the afternoon before. He asked if we enjoyed our stay. I indicated that it could have been better. He didn't ask why, or what was wrong, and didn't seem to care. We went outside to the valet parking area, and stood for a long time with our luggage and nobody came up to take the ticket. I walked down the way a bit and found three of the valet parkers standing around just talking to each other. I stood there and they didn't even look at me. I finally held up the ticket and one of them took it, and went and got the car. I walked around the back with my luggage, and he got out without opening the back. So, I walked around to hit the button and he said, "Oh, it isn't open?". So, from start to finish, the visit was below expectations. Don't get me wrong; the hotel is clean and comfortable. I just think that the staff people we were exposed to had a poor attitude, and seemed to be doing as little as possible to get through their shift. This property, in two stays went from a place I definitely wanted to go back to, to a place I never want to go back to. In Southern California, we have so many choices of places to go and relax, that there is just no reason to pick a place that doesn't appear to want to work to earn the business. The hotel isn't located near any sort of attraction; so really, they have to make it up in service. At that, they failed miserably.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton but a bit musty!”
Reviews.Author: namenotinuse
Reviews.Content: Location isn't bad: near a couple of strip malls and two or three average-to-good restaurants (Gaucho Grill across the road was probably the best that I tried) within walking distance. The hotel itself had a musty smell in the lobby and in elevators but the rooms themselves were up to the usual Hilton standard. I love the fact that they deliver the LA Times in the morning (USA Today really doesn't cut it for me, I'm afraid). Nice little feature I noticed: the clock radio is designed for the Hilton chain and is extremely easy to configure & use. Sounds stupid, I know, but how many times have you not bothered setting an alarm on the clock radio because a) the clock was wrong; b) you didn't have time to figure out the controls or c) you didn't want to be searching for the snooze in the morning. Restaurant was quiet, the service was prompt and the food was good. Breakfast service was efficient with very friendly staff. If you want to park your own car (instead of using the valet service) I think it could be made clearer what you need to do. i.e. where you should park and the fact that you need your ticket stamped for the duration of your stay etc...

Reviews.Title: “totally fine stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a couple of nights through priceline: $66 plus tax. it isn't the best hilton i've everbeen to, but for this low price, i'm not complaining. lobby is nice, friendly staff. the room is nice and big and very clean. nothing out of the ordinary, but totally fine - especially for the price. regular rate on hilton.com was $189. the valet parking is a little unneccesary, but for $12 doesn't break the bank either. all in all, a good business travel experience

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business traveler, not so great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've valued the opinions on TripAdvisor for a couple of years now, so I made a major mistake by not consulting here first before I made reservations at Hilton Woodland Hills. My second mistake was to use Hotwire, which does not allow you to easily verify what hotel you are staying at before you commit, and then once you do, you can't cancel or get a refund. After making the reservations, I consulted TripAdvisor to read some sobering reviews of this hotel, and they turned out to be pretty accurate. Too bad I couldn't cancel out. I had high hopes for this hotel because of Hilton's reputation. I had stayed at the Hilton near the Burbank Airport and had a great suite and great meals at that hotel's restaurant - one of the excellent Daily Grill franchises. For some strange reason, I thought that the Hilton in Woodland Hills would be comparable. No such luck! First thing, as another TripAdvisor member said, there's the nasty $10-$12 daily hotel parking fee (can't remember the exact amount). With that factored in, I didn't save all that much by using Hotwire. The rooms were not particularly outstanding, and not what I would expect from a four-star hotel. Next complaint -- my grade-school children are really fanatics about swimming, so a nice pool was really a requirement. When we asked where the hotel pool was, I was shocked to learn that there wasn't a hotel pool. But all was not lost -- turns out they have a courtesy arrangement with the fitness center next door, and the hotel front desk gave us a pile of towels and a pass. Our kids were amused by all the sweaty bodies as we filed through the fitness center on our way to the lap pool. We had a plesant enough time, considering that the pool is shaded on all sides by the parking garage and hotel. We had to make room for a water aerobics class in the pool, so that was our cue to leave. All in all, the kids had fun at the pool, so I can't say it was an entire failure. But certainly not convenient to check in at the hotel's front desk every time you want to take a swim. We ate breakfast in the hotel's cafe. It was expensive, and nothing special. There is a Cheesecake Factory literally outside the front entrance, and around the corner is a BJ's Brewhouse. I've been wanting to go to a BJs near where we live, so I was very happy to find one right next door to the hotel. Not only did they have fresh-brewed beer and grilled salmon for me, but they also had a great kids menu. My wife was also able to find something she liked, so I felt vindicated for my mistake of chosing this hotel in the first place. My advice in closing -- check here at TripAdvisor before you book any trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room but disliked the parking situation”
Reviews.Author: MGreene16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights while in the LA area. The lobby was pleasant, the desk clerks very friendly, and our room was on a higher floor with a great view. It looked recently renovated and was very nicely decorated and quite comfortable. We did not use the pool since it was really the health club pool and was in the shade during the times we would have gone there. The parking situation was not favorable; if you didn't use valet parking, it was about a two block walk to the garage elevators. Considering the situation, it seemed overpriced at $12/day. We also had trouble exiting the garage since it was not explained that we had to het a new ticked stampled every time we went in and out. Everytime we returned to the hotel the staff greeted us with, "welcome back!" We stayed here since we are Hilton Honors members and got a good price, but it really wasn't near anywhere we were going. We did find a very nice bagel place nearby on Ventura called "Western Bagels" though.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Worn-Out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline ($52 + tax). The thermostat in the first room wouldn't go below 80 degrees. After an hour in that sauna, we moved to another room where the thermostat wouldn't go below 78 degrees. My wife cracked the code. You had to take the cover off the thermostat to discover the directions on lowering the temperature. The decor is 1980's Art Nouveau. Really bad and terribly dated. Ugliest bedspreads ever. Wierd little convenience store in the lobby that sells very little that you would actually want to buy (food/water/etc.). There's a Cheesecake Factory next door, if you're into chain restaurants. Wouldn't stay there again. This pllace needs a major infusion of money.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: oundine
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this hotel is getting such good ratings. The lobby looks great which gave me hope that the room itself would be good. When I walked in, it looked like your standard hilton, sheraton, etc room. But I didn't like the color they painted the bathroom door - a beige-brown color. Made it look like some closet where you'd store your brooms. Before that, the door handle was hard to turn and I had to force it open. The room itself was sizeable but the windows did not have any screens so someone could easily fall out if they weren't being careful. The floor had obvious stains on it which made the room look dirty. The bathroom really showed the age and they didn't do a good job of cleaning. Biofilm and mildew was clearly evident on the shower head and on the grouts. Wasn't profuse but definitely was noticeable. I ordered room service the first night. The appetizer was ok, the salad was actually decent but the chicken was horrendous. It felt like I was chewing on rubber. The staff was courteous and helpful for as much as they can be includingi the cleaning lady. However they messed up my card and locked me out of my room. Parking is ample in a nearby garage. Your room is charged $10 for the day so if you have a visitor just coming once a day, don't bother charging it to your room. The maximum daily rate is $8.75. The surrounding area is quite nice with several nice restaurants that are within walking distance along with some shopping plazas. They are walkable but considering the traffic, you may want to just drive for safety reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: edwhite78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October of 2004 for three nights. We reserved the hotel through Hotwire and thus received a very good price on the room. The hotel itself has nice facilities. The rooms are clean and modern with wonderful massaging showerheads and comfy pillowtop mattresses. The staff was helpful and friendly - we had a small maintenance issue during our stay and it was remedied in a very quick and friendly manner. The parking for the hotel is in an adjacent parking structure - it is not cheap at $13 per day, but it is reasonably convenient and secure. There are also quite a few restaurants (cheesecake factory, sports bar/brewery) and shopping locations (mall, fry's electronics, etc.) nearby. The only small complaint that we had about the hotel is that the cleaning staff was occasionaly loud. Our room was near the service area on the floor, so we could sometimes hear them talking (loudly) to one another in the hallway. Otherwise, it was a nice place with friendly service, a good location, and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire weekend rate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I were visiting family in Santa Monica and decided to check out some Hotwire deals. Their package price for this location on a weekend was $270 for two nights, PLUS a mid size rental from Hertz. Taxes, etc. included. The hotel was about 20 minutes from where we wanted to be, which for LA is nothing. Very clean, very quiet, top quality. Busy place for weekends with receptions, lots going on in the lounge. Breakfast was ok, even if it was served slow, but with top quality service and caring staff. Cheesecake factory is next door, which is where we ate dinner or went for desert. I was expecting it to be a "dead" location in an office complex but it obviously draws a lot of locals and is pretty lively. Honestly, if you are staying in the area I don't know how you can do any better for LA/Valley prices at this quality level. They put us on the 12th floor, great views, absolutely no complaints what so ever. You could do so much worse and pay so much more any where else in LA, Hollywood, and the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a business trip. Paid $180 for two full beds. The location worked well and I liked that it was next door to a Cheesecake Factory and had complimentary access to LA Fitness, also next door. The room was a typical one for Hilton. Comfortable w/ a nice view of the mountains. The loud noise of doors slamming shut was a nuisance, but not uncommon at a hotel like this. A decent hotel w/ courteous staff. By the way, hotel self-parking is about $8.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, bad reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was attending my nephew's wedding in Hollywood. Although we could have stayed with relatives, my husband and I decided to make the trip more of a holiday and to stay at the Hilton instead. I had made reservations six weeks in advance and requested a King size bed in a non smoking room. When we went to register at the desk, (we had the confirmation number) the clerk claimed that a King size, non-smoking room was not specified, nor was one available, and that we would have to stay in a room with two double beds. My husband and I are tall people, and this was not the romantic holiday we pictured. I became extremely upset and asked to speak to the manager. At that point the desk clerk suddenly found us the room we had requested. The adrenaline took awhile to wear off and it spoiled our initial experience after a long drive.

Reviews.Title: “Staff could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my family here for one Saturday night. I booked a towers room and we were put on the 12th floor (12, 14, 15th floors are tower rooms). However, they never told me that the towers lounge is not open on the weekends (what's the use of the extra costs?) The room was in great good shape. Furniture, bedding and bathroom were all nice. The pool is a joke. The hotel has an agreement to use the LA Fitness pool next door. You have to get a pass at the front desk and then sign-in at the club. I asked for towels and they said you had to get them at the hotel. Went to the front desk again and they said you had to get them from your room! It would have been nice for them to tell you this when you get the passes. The pool is a lap pool and has a very small deck area. We had mixed staff help. Some were very helpful but others didn't seem to care about you. I would stay here again and give them another chance.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Woodland Hills
HotelInfo.Address: 6360 Canoga Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 91367
